body: Interactive Panoramas        Sue Lake - Deep within the wilds of Glacier National Park David Restivo, NPS       Have you ever looked at a picture and wondered what was just outside the frame, or maybe behind the photographer? These Quicktime VR panoramic images allow viewers to scan right and left and in come cases all the way around. They provide a way of getting an overall impression of a scene and not just one static view. Click on the links and when the panorama opens in a new window, hold down the mouse on the image and drag to the right or left to pan around. Use the + and - buttons to zoom in and out. You will need to have Quicktime installed on your computer.         Lake McDonald - July 3, 2005 - 1.5Mb         Fire Recovery Along the Camas Road - July 3, 2005 - 1.5Mb         Two Medicine Lake - July 4, 2005 - 1.3Mb         Beargrass in the Two Medicine Picnic Area - July 4, 2005 - 575Kb         Running Eagle Falls - July 4, 2005 - 738Kb         Bowman Lake - July 27, 2005 - 1.4Mb         Twin Falls - July 30, 2005 - 1.5Mb         Upper Two Medicine Lake - July 31, 2005 - 992Kb         Sperry Chalet - August 7, 2005 - 1.7Mb         Lake Ellen Wilson - August 7, 2005 - 1.7Mb         Haystack Butte on the Highline Trail - August 20, 2005 - 787Kb         Highline Trail near Granite Park - August 20, 2005 - 878Kb         Sunset at Granite Park - August 20, 2005 - 538Kb         Sue Lake Overlook - August 21, 2005 - 923Kb         Meadows at Fifty Mountain - August 22, 2005 - 922Kb         Hole in the Wall - August 23, 2005 - 544Kb         Sun Point -August 25, 2005 - 866Kb         Going-to-the-Sun Road - August 25, 2005 - 698Kb         Oberlin Bend Scenic Overlook - August 25, 2005 - 543Kb      Panoramic photos by Bill Hayden and David Restivo
title: Glacier National Park: Interactive Panoramas
